title: 110_hr5600
content: The Act is titled the "District of Columbia Court, Offender Supervision, Parole, and Public Defender Employees Equity Act of 2008." It allows retirement credit for certain employees transferred from District of Columbia service to federal service. Any individual serving as an employee or Member on or after the date of enactment of this Act who performed qualifying District of Columbia service shall have such service included in calculating creditable service under title 5, United States Code, for specific provisions related to annuity eligibility, retirement, survivor annuities, and disability benefits. Qualifying District of Columbia service is not considered when calculating benefits from the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. Qualifying District of Columbia service is excluded from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. In this Act, "qualifying District of Columbia service" refers to service performed by individuals in specific roles within the District of Columbia government, excluding it from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. Service performed by individuals in specific roles within the District of Columbia government is excluded from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. This includes service performed by individuals as an employee of the District of Columbia Public Defender Service prior to certain effective dates. Service performed by individuals in specific roles within the District of Columbia government is excluded from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund, including service performed by individuals as an employee of the District of Columbia Department of Corrections before certain effective dates. Service performed by individuals in specific roles within the District of Columbia government is excluded from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund if the service was performed before the individual's coverage as a Federal Government employee and the individual did not receive credit under specific provisions of title 5, United States Code. The Office of Personnel Management will accept certification from the District of Columbia government regarding an individual's qualifying service and its duration.
